attributes.action: Introduce self defence classes as part of the national curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 85,000 women and 12,000 men (aged 16 - 59) experience rape, attempted rape or sexual assault in England and Wales alone every year; that's roughly 11 of the most serious sexual offences every hour.

Self defence is a Human Right so why aren’t we taught how to defend ourselves?
attributes.background:
Self defence should be added to the national curriculum so our young people can be taught how to defend themselves if they ever in a desperate situation where they need to. 

With violent and sexual crime being so high we need to know that our young people can defend themselves safely.

rejection.details: You might like to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578987
